title: Walter Hagen
summary: Walter Charles Hagen (December 21, 1892 â€“ October 6, 1969) was an American professional golfer and a major figure in golf in the first half of the 20th century.[1] His tally of 11 professional majors is third behind Jack Nicklaus (18) and Tiger Woods (15). Known as the "father of professional golf," he brought publicity, prestige, big prize money and lucrative endorsements to the sport.[2]  Hagen is rated one of the greatest golfers ever.[3]
